publications.name: TEAFormer: TEnsor-Augmented Transformer for Multi-Dimensional Time Series Forecasting
publications.summary:
Developed a novel multi-dimensional (tensor) time series Transformer architecture, integrating a Tensor-Augmentation module with Transformer-based models. This is a frontier study to apply tensors in transformers.
Designed a Tensor-Augmentation module that performs tensor expansion and compression, enabling efficient multi-view feature learning while reducing computational costs of self-attention and information aggregation.
Conducted experiments demonstrating TEAFormer outperforms baseline models across six real-world benchmarks.

projects.name: AI Dining Concierge Chatbot
projects.summary:
Built a serverless chatbot for restaurant recommendations using Amazon Lex, integrated with a web UI hosted on S3 and triggered via API Gateway + Lambda.Collected user inputs and push them to SQS.
Deployed a scheduled Lambda worker queried OpenSearch and DynamoDB for restaurant data and sent results via SES.
Ingested and indexed 5,000+ restaurant records through Yelp API; enabled fast search and personalized email responses.
Designed fully decoupled, event-driven architecture using IAM, CloudWatch, and managed AWS services.

projects.name: Multi-agent Trading Signal Dashboard
projects.summary:
Developed a real-time trading signal dashboard  with AI-driven multi-agent framework for US stock market analysis.
Achieved +12% cumulative return in 7 trading days through backtesting.
Developed a full-stack dashboard using FastAPI (Python), React (Next.js), TypeScript, and PostgreSQL, enabling users to input stock tickers and receive live trading signals with market insights.
Implemented WebSocket-based real-time updates, ensuring signals sentiment dynamically reflects the latest market.

projects.summary: Build an object detection and tracking model for UCSD women’s team soccer training with a partner, using baseline model NetVLAD++ and CALF, developed novel feature pooling methods by incorporating CLIP, ViT, and PaddleDetection to extract input features, and achieved 20%  improvement in MAP score
